paper_abstract: A fundamental idea and realization of networks arises in it variety of areas of science and engineering. Their theoretical underpinnings stem from graph theory where numerous fundamental concepts being formulated and solved there have become of immediate interest at the applied side. In this study, our focus is oil the weighted maximum clique problems highly challenging problem in graph theory. The essence of the problem is to find the nodes with the maximum total of weights in a graph where an edge connects every pair of nodes, meaning every node connects to every other node. We propose an algorithm to find all the weighted cliques as well as the weighted maximum clique in order of size using the framework of DNA computing. (C) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A DNA-based algorithm for arranging weighted cliques
